reviews.review_msg: i have had beau as a TA for two classes (COGS100 and PSYC352) and he has just been the best for both. very easy to contact and gives in depth feedback on all assignments. it's really hard to find TAs who aren't praying on my downfall at SFU, but beau has always been very caring and supportive of his students!

The worst class I've taken at SFU! The course consisted of a midterm, term paper, and a final. We were given barely any instruction in order to write the 10-page paper (worth 30%) and her midterm/final tests questions were not based off of course content at all! Do not take this course!

The material is interesting but the delivery of this course is horrible, everything is vague and she doesn't stick to what the syllabus says which shows she has little respect for her students. I'm a good student I have a 3.5 GPA I'm telling you to avoid this class if you can.

Taken two classes with her now, both online, and the problem both times is that you essentially have to teach yourself the material. She does provide lectures but they do not provide anything more than what's in the readings. Also, she does writing assignments that are arguably a waste of everyone's time and barely demonstrate your understanding.

Disorganized lectures and a lot of the time it seems like the professor does not understand the material she is teaching. Exam questions and structure are a mess. Expectations for final paper are confusing. Highly recommend avoiding this course.

Just bad. Unclear and disorganized. Essay exam questions were confusing and unclear, and hard to decipher what they wanted.. yet it was marked quite harshly. Class was not engaging, slides with her talking over. She is approachable and friendly but it feels like you are set up to do poorly.

Dr. Broesch is very knowledgeable about her field and gives many examples of great studies but her lecture are very unorganized. When I took this class is was taught online due to COVID and there was NO communication with students and it was very difficult to figure out her expectations for assignments.

This class was engaging. She lectured in 20 minute bursts and then had activities or skype sessions. it felt like a good pace. her slides were organized but she was usually a bit rushed at the end of lecture. could work on timing. Inspiring! She loves the topic.

She tends to be little disorganized. Her first quiz was very difficult, but the second and the final quiz was okay. The articles are mandatory to read to participate in team questions and to do the quiz. The paper is unreasonably very harshly marked by the TA. This course is easy to pass if you read all the assigned articles.

I can commend Tanya for having a positive attitude towards her students, but my experience with her has been less than ideal. Her lectures are disorganized and her exams are among the worst youll ever take. Questions are poorly phrased and multiple options are almost always correct, making the distinctions between right and wrong a big grey area.

Dr. Broesch is a professor who truly wants her students to do well. She is approachable and I recommend going to her office hours. Make sure you MEMORIZE the papers you read each week as the exams are based directly off the papers.

She is a good prof. Condensed class. However, this class was all over the place. There was a lot of group discussions and she didn't lecture much. Lots of readings, expect 2 readings each class roughly 10-30 pages long each. There was skype session as well but not tested on that. Exams were based all of readings and slides.
